answers.text:
Hi Edward,
On the Knowledge Network we have a few resources that might be of use to you as you explore possible innovations in brush collection in your community. 
-This previously asked question asks for RFPs for waste removal and the answers include sections on brush waste. You might get some ideas for your own community based on what these other communities are asking for. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/21734/Example_RFPs_for_Solid_Waste_Collection
-This article on process improvement touches on brush collection and pick up. http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9311/public/feature2.cfm?title=Process%20Improvement%2C%20No%20Problem&subtitle=&author=David%20Eichenthal%20and%20Cory%20Fleming
-this sustainable innovations presentation touches on waste removal but you may be able to apply some of their innovative ideas to your brush collection system. 
http://webapps.icma.org/conference_Handouts/handouts2013/Sustainable%20Innovations%20presentation.pdf
I hope you find these resources useful. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Edward Holmes
text: Borough of State College, PA, is researching brush collection options.  We offer weekly brush collection service on a call-in basis in which two public works employees manually feed brush into a chipper.  We have experienced several work-related injuries in recent years and are seeking alternatives to this traditional collection method.  If you have implemented an innovative solution or have tried some other method of collecting, please share your experiences, good or bad.
title: Brush Collection
